reviews.title: Great location not many amenities
reviews.text: Nicely decorated rooms that are slightly small. Location is ideal with harbor views and short walk to main city center. Very attentive staff but not overly helpful with luggage.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel and we loved our stay in one of the Terrace Rooms (with large terrace). The feather beds are the best we have ever encountered in our previous stays at 4 or 5 star hotels around the world (and we have done a lot of them).
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: Could not fault the staff they were friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: No Pool
reviews.text: The only negative comment we can give was the price of the breakfast buffet at 28 Euro's per person. For our two night stay we simply walked down the street and had a fruit juice, large coffee, bread and croissant for 6 Euro's each. I would not consider us as a "cheap traveller" but 56 Euro's (US$75) per couple, the cost for breakfast was unreasonable.

We thoroughly enjoyed our 2- night stay at the Grand Hotel (43 Blvd. Thiers) in St. Jean de Luz. The hotel itself is beautiful, situated right on the water, with a lovely bar-cocktail area right there. It is close to everything (short walking distance). We would definitely stay here again. We had made a conscious decision to stay in St. Jean de Luz (vs. Biarritz) and we were so happy we had made that choice.

reviews.title: Explore Basque lite with a french flair
Perfect location,. great service, lovely hotel
reviews.text: Stayed for a long weekend in August, we were lucky with fantastic weather and this hotel which I loved. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. The facilities were excellent, a good sized pool and a huge spa jacuzzi. The gym, although large doesn't have much equipment but who needs it with the beach on your doorstep? Go out for a run and get some sea air, you can go to to the gym at home!

The bar and restaurant are well presented but overpriced as you'd expect but you are spoilt for choice with the restaurants in town so it isn't a problem. Do treat yourself to one drink (coctails 12-14 euro from what I can remember) out on the bar's terrace and watch the sun set.
reviews.title: Agree with the others
Great views and good town
reviews.text: Rooms very confortable and very clean. Beds are turned down in the evening, maids do a very good job. Bathrobes good quailty. Toiletries provided include bath foam, shampoo, cotton buds, nailfile, perfumed water, body lotion and bath salts. Air con is extremely quiet and extremely effective.
Note: you do have to pay for the parking at this hotel which is 16euro per day (free on Sunday)
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Good family option
reviews.text: We stayed in late July in one of the Ocean View rooms, frightfully expensive at 450 Euros plus tax per night and the room was very small, a bed, a small armchair and a desk, but we had a huge, overlooked, terrace and World Class views.

I know it is pricey; on this trip though we have our eyes closed to price, so this review written without regard to value. Hotel is clean and modern, we are family of four and booked some sort of mini-suite which is basically a master bedroom, a master hallway, one bathroom off master hallway, and 2nd bedroom with pull out bed/couch. Had all in room ammenities including hot water heater and instant coffees [important to me]. Beds had fancy cushioned sheets [I dont know names... duvees...].
reviews.title: Clean, Modern, But Missing Internet in Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The big problem was that it was advertised with in room wireless internet access. When I tried, they said I need special code from front desk to access network, so I got code, but still could not get reception in room [Room 14]. I had to work in lobby with laptop [and their lobby is tiny, tiny, only 3-4 sitting chairs/couch and coffee table. Upon noticing me working in lobby for countless hours, they offered me side room/office off of lobby, but still I was removed from my family. So, dont plan on in room internet access!
